SENT.plain: The locus for Saethre-Chotzen syndrome, a common autosomal dominant disorder of craniosynostosis and digital anomalies, was previously mapped to chromosome 7p between D7S513 and D7S516
We used linkage and haplotype analyses to narrow the disease locus to an 8-cM region between D7S664 and D7S507
The tightest linkage was to locus D7S664 (Z = 7.16, theta = .00)
Chromosomes from a Saethre-Chotzen syndrome patient with t(2;7) (p23;p22) were used for in situ hybridization with YAC clones containing D7S664 and D7S507
The D7S664 locus was found to lie distal to the 7p22 breakpoint, and the D7S507 locus was deleted from the translocation chromosomes
These genetic and physical mapping data independently show that the disease locus resides in this interval
